content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function in Julia that does what you described:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, r" \t") # Split the text into words
    result = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(join(result, " ")) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(result, "") # Add a new line to the result
        end
        push!(result, word)
    end
    
    return join(result, " ")
end
```

Here's an example of using this function:

```julia
text = "This is an example text that needs to be wrapped. It should not exceed 10 characters per line."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
